thread.title: Juan Mata 'convinced' end of season will bring Manchester United 'a lot of joy'
thread.title_full: Juan Mata 'convinced' end of season will bring Manchester United 'a lot of joy'

author: James Whaling
title: Juan Mata 'convinced' end of season will bring Manchester United 'a lot of joy'
text:
Sport Juan Mata 'convinced' end of season will bring Manchester United 'a lot of joy' United closed to within for points of fourth-placed Liverpool with their 3-1 win over Boro, which has left Mata in confident mood Share Mata is in bullish mood (Photo: John Peters) Share Get   
Manchester United midfielder Juan Mata is in bullish mood as the Red Devils enter the final part of the season. 
The Spaniard has predicted the last months of the season will bring 'a lot of joy' to Old Trafford, with United bidding to win the Europa League and finish in the Premier League top four. 
Victories over Rostov and Middlesbrough last week put them closer to those respective targets, with the club now in the quarter-finals of Europe's second-tier competition, where they will face Anderlecht. 
And they closed to within for points of fourth-placed Liverpool with their 3-1 win over Boro, which has left Mata in confident mood. Mata in action against Middlesbrough (Photo: Stu Forster / Getty) The Spaniard nets against Rostov (Photo: Matthew Peters) 
In his blog on United's official website, he said: "Two consecutive wins allow us to close March (due to the international break) in a very positive way, and we are convinced that the end of the season will bring us a lot of joy. 
"The week has been very demanding physically but we gave everything we had and, despite the FA Cup disappointment, we have moved forward in Europe and also we have got closer to the top four in the Premier League. 
"The first win was against Rostov and it also led to being in the draw of the Europa League quarter-finals. As I’ve been saying since the season started, we’re all very excited about this competition. 
"Against Anderlecht we will have the opportunity to prove it again and try to make it to the next round. The second win was against Middlesbrough on Sunday. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
